channel.title: c10 on dfangx's website
channel.description: Recent content in c10 on dfangx's website

item.title: Day 119, 1 Chronicles 7-10
item.description: The author recounts the genealogies of the tribes of Issachar, Benjamin, Naphtali, Manasseh, Ephraim, and Asher. Each genealogy is of varying lengths with varying degrees of detail, likely reflecting the sources that were accessible to the author.

item.title: Day 112, Psalm 6, 8-10, 14, 16, 19, 21
item.description: Psalm 6 is a cry for help to God during suffering and a statement of hope in the steadfast love of God.

item.title: Day 100, 1 Samuel 9-12
item.description: Saul is introduced as a Benjaminite searching for the missing donkeys of his father. Unable to find them, he turns to the seer, who is Samuel.

item.title: Day 93, Judges 10-12
item.description: Tola and Jair served as judges for Israel for a number years. After they died, Israel disobeyed God again, so they were given into the hands of the Philistines and Ammonites.

item.title: Day 84, oshua 9-11
item.description: The kings in the land heard of what happened at Ai, and five of them gathered to fight against Israel. However, the Gibeonites deceived Israel into sparing them, showing the dangers of relying on oneself instead of God.

item.title: Day 73, Deuteronomy 8-10
item.description: Moses reminds the people to remember God. Just as how Israel witnessed God providing for them and dwelling among them in the wilderness, they are to remember God and keep his commandments when they have settled and have received the blessings of God.

item.title: Day 58, Numbers 8-10
item.description: God orders Moses to cleanse the Levites by sprinkling the water of purification and giving a grain and sin offering. The Levites are offered as a wave offering to God before the entire congregation.

item.title: Day 46, Leviticus 8-10
item.description: Aaron and his sons are consecrated as priests according to the previous instructions given by God in Exodus. They are washed and clothed with the priest’s garments.

item.title: Day 33, Exodus 10-12
item.description: During the plague of locusts, Pharaoh’s servants urge Pharaoh to let the people of Israel go. At this point, the economy of Egypt was ruined.

item.title: Day 6, Job 10-13
item.description: Job continues with a plea to God, asking why God had brought so much suffering into his life. Zopher mocks Job in response, saying that Job is already getting repaid much less than his guilt deserves.

item.title: Day 3, Genesis 8-11
item.description: God remembered Noah and those that he had spared from the flood. Therefore, God caused the floodwaters to recede. When land could be seen, Noah sent out a raven and a dove several times, continually checking for the day which the floodwaters completely recede.
